means: 准备( prepare的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: Good luck is when an opportunity comes along and you're prepared for it.
sentence.Network_cn: 好运就是当机会来临时，你早已做好了准备。

sentence.Network_en: Many students are not adequately prepared for higher education.
sentence.Network_cn: 许多学生并未做好接受高等教育的充分准备。

sentence.Network_en: A minority of officers were prepared to bend the rules.
sentence.Network_cn: 少数官员准备篡改规则。

which thou hast prepared before the face of all peoples ., 即你在万民之前早准备好的.

虞字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 忧虑;忧患〖 worry〗 准备,防范〖 prepare〗 企望;期待〖 hope;expect〗.
高一英语单词表 - 豆丁网 ... venue n 比赛地点；体育比赛场馆 prepare vt 准备；预备 preparation n 准备；预备.

entry.def: If you are prepared to do something, you are willing to do it if necessary.

example.ex: Are you prepared to take industrial action?...
example.tran: 你们愿意采取劳工行动吗？

example.ex: Members of the KGB service were only prepared to take orders from the President.
example.tran: 克格勃的成员只接受总统的命令。

entry.def: If you are prepared for something that you think is going to happen, you are ready for it.

example.ex: Police are prepared for large numbers of demonstrators...
example.tran: 警方已经为应对大量示威者做好了准备。

example.ex: I'm well prepared for a 12-round fight.
example.tran: 我已经为迎战12个回合的拳击比赛作好了充分准备。

entry.tran: 预先准备好的；事先做好的
entry.def: You can describe something as prepared when it has been done or made beforehand, so that it is ready when it is needed.

example.ex: He ended his prepared statement by thanking the police.
example.tran: 在这份事先准备好的声明的最后，他对警方表示了感谢。

means.word_mean: 1. made ready or fit or suitable beforehand;
3. equipped or prepared with necessary intellectual resources;

sentences.sentence: "graduates well equipped to handle such problems"

auth_sentence.content: The dried fish needs to be prepared in advance.
auth_sentence.res_content: The dried fish needs to be prepared in advance.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The dried fish needs to be prepared in advance.

auth_sentence.content: Scoop the mix into the prepared muffin tin cups.
auth_sentence.res_content: Scoop the mix into the prepared muffin tin cups.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Scoop the mix into the prepared muffin tin cups.

auth_sentence.content: Prepared properly, they are quite safe to eat.
auth_sentence.res_content: Prepared properly, they are quite safe to eat.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Prepared properly, they are quite safe to eat.

Sentence.sentence: Moreover, students should be prepared not just for their first job, but for their 4th and 5th jobs, as there's little reason to doubt that people entering the workforce today will be called upon to play many different roles over the course of their careers.
The ones who will do the best in this new environment will be those whose educations have prepared them to be flexible
We encourage students to go on to college whether they are prepared or not, or have a clear sense of purpose or interest, and now have the highest college dropout rate in the world

The Three-Year Solution Hartwick College, a small liberal-arts school in upstate New York, makes New York, makes this offer to well prepared students: earn your undergraduate degree in three years instead of four, and save about 543,000—the amount of one year's tuition and fees
Perhaps, the study speculated, having a white roommate helps academically prepared black students adjust to a predominantly white university.
But you have to be prepared for a long wait, maybe up to two years.

sentences.en: a table full of specially prepared food
sentences.cn: 满满一桌特别精心准备的食物

sentences.en: a Mafia member who was prepared to testify for the authorities
sentences.cn: 准备为当局作证的黑手党成员

sentences.en: a young man who is prepared to aim high
sentences.cn: 一个胸怀大志的年轻人
